meta.article_title: January 22, 2018 - Doubles Signals and Why You Should Use Them

debutant.nom: Signal the serve with index finger pointing down for backspin
debutant.description: Use under-the-table signals to inform partner of serve type; use backspin signal (pointing down) for short serves.

debutant.nom: Signal the serve with thumb or index finger pointing up for topspin
debutant.description: Use under-the-table signals to inform partner of serve type; use topspin signal (pointing up) for high-arcing serves.

exercices_complementaires.description: Use agreed-upon signals to communicate serve type and direction; focus on consistency and clear communication.

metriques_progression.nom: Master 3-4 different serves and their corresponding signals
metriques_progression.description: Practice serving and signaling with partner; focus on consistency, accuracy, and clear communication.

erreurs_a_eviter.nom: Stalling or delaying decision-making during serves
erreurs_a_eviter.description: Practice under-the-table signaling and committing to a serve quickly; focus on clear communication and quick decision-making.
